revision.comment:
/* Noun */ #* '''2001''', Jonathan Franzen, ''The Corrections'' #*: “We Norwegians are great readers,” Mrs. Nygren took the opportunity to remark.
“And great '''yakkers''',” Mr. Söderblad muttered.
revision.text:
==English== ===Etymology 1=== {{suffix|en|yak|er|id2=agent noun}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{audio|en|En-au-yakker.ogg|Audio (AU)}} ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|slang}} One who [[yak#Verb|yaks]]; a [[chatterbox]] or [[motormouth]]. #* '''1999''', {{w|"Weird Al" Yankovic}}, "{{w|It's All About The Pentiums}}" (song): #*: Wanna be hackers? Code crackers? Slackers? Wastin' time with all the chat room '''yakkers'''? #* '''2001''', Jonathan Franzen, ''The Corrections'' #*: “We Norwegians are great readers,” Mrs. Nygren took the opportunity to remark.
“And great '''yakkers''',” Mr. Söderblad muttered. ===Etymology 2=== Said to be from the flight path of the [[yawker bird]].[https://www.si.com/mlb/2017/05/23/curveball-clayton-kershaw-lance-mccullers] ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|baseball|slang}} A [[curveball]] or [[slider]].
